title: Looking for fonts similar to the Twix logo
content:
Hello FontFans!

I'm back with another request. The community has been very helpful and I'd appreciate one more question:

This time, I'm trying to find a font that looks similar to the twix font

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120228130631im_/http:/typophile.com/files/twix.jpg)

I'm sure the logo itself was done as an in-house custom job, but if anyone could recommend a font that looks similar, I would definitely appreciate it. I've been searching online for quite some time and haven't come across anything yet.

Thanks!  
-Brian
author: DizyDevil

comments.content:
Reminds me a little of Dogma Script from Emigre

[http://www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=90](http://web.archive.org/web/20120228130631/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=90 "http://www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=90")

Thanks Patty, I'll check that out. Any other ideas? Please keep them coming!

-Brian

Maybe Positype Sneakers Script is a good start?

[http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000010#flont](http://web.archive.org/web/20120228130631/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000010#flont "http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000010#flont")

Its only four characters, I bet its custom. Maybe someone has made a free font based on it. Try the free font sites and some elbow grease. If you only need four characters you might consider drawing it yourself. Just some thoughts.
